title: Linguine with Tuna Pesto
introduction: This delightful Sicilian pasta dish features an uncooked sauce that bears a resemblance to pesto, but with a distinctive twist of anchovies. Just before serving, the mixture is combined with tender linguine and flaked tuna for a rich and savory meal.
ingredients: 1 cup tightly packed fresh basil leaves
3/4 cup tightly packed fresh parsley leaves
1 (7-ounce) can tuna in oil (preferably imported Italian or Spanish tuna in olive oil)
instructions: In a food processor fitted with the steel blade, chop the basil, parsley, pine nuts, and garlic until fine. Add the anchovy fillets, oil, and lemon juice and process until smooth.
Bring at least 4 quarts of water to a boil in a large pot. Meanwhile, in a large serving bowl, mash the tuna with a fork. Stir in the sauce.

Add 2 tablespoons of salt, then the pasta, to the boiling water. Stir well, gently pushing the pasta down until it is completely covered with water. Cook the pasta, stirring frequently, until al dente, tender yet still firm to the bite. Drain the pasta, reserving some of the cooking water.
Transfer the pasta to the bowl with the sauce. Add some of the cooking water and toss well. Serve immediately.
